title: 114_hr4302
content: The curr_chunk is about the termination of bank functions. The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating functions transferred from the Bank, with obligations ending once all debts are settled. A report to Congress is required upon completion. The Secretary will terminate obligations of the Bank once all debts are settled, and a report will be sent to Congress upon completion. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for specific duties outlined in Section 8. The Secretary is responsible for implementing the Act, including administration, dissolution of functions, outstanding obligations, and other necessary actions. The Secretary may also delegate functions to wind up and dissolve transferred functions. The Secretary is responsible for implementing the Act, including dissolution of functions and outstanding affairs of the Bank. The Secretary may also delegate functions to wind up and dissolve transferred functions, with no authorization for Bank positions after 60 days of abolishment. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS AND REPEALS. Repeal of the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions from various Acts. The SEED Act of 1989 and Export-Import Bank Act Amendments of 1978 are repealed, along with related sections from other Acts. The SEED Act of 1989 and Export-Import Bank Act Amendments of 1978 are repealed, along with related sections from other Acts, including sections from the Bank Export Services Act and Public Law 90-390. Sections from various Acts, including the SEED Act of 1989 and Export-Import Bank Act Amendments of 1978, are repealed. This includes sections from the Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983, Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 1990, and Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988. Additionally, amendments are made to title 31, United States Code. Amendments are made to various sections of the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988, title 31 of the United States Code, and related compensation provisions in title 5. Amendments are made to sections of the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988, title 31 of the United States Code, and related compensation provisions in title 5, including changes to positions at level iii and iv in the Export-Import Bank of Washington. Amendments are made to positions at level iv in the Export-Import Bank of Washington, including the elimination of the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. Amendments are made to positions at level iv in the Export-Import Bank of Washington, including the elimination of the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. The repeals and amendments made by this section shall take effect on the abolishment date. The Secretary shall submit a report to the relevant Committees on other amendments to Federal statute. The Export-Import Bank will undergo amendments at level iv positions, including the removal of the Office of Inspector General. The repeals and amendments will be effective on the abolishment date. The Secretary will provide a report to Congress on additional amendments to Federal statutes as needed. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal law, executive order, rule, regulation, or delegation of authority to a department or office affected by this Act is deemed to refer to the new department or office. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. The term "function" includes duties, powers, activities, and programs. The term "office" includes various organizational entities.
